availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Riley M. Calvert (Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician - 1850 miner in CA)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Rhoda Prince Calvert in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in April 1853. Father of Fanny Calvert, William Calvert, James Calvert, Thomas Calvert, and George Calvert. Miner in Yuba County, California, in 1850. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned five enslaved individuals in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, California, Yuba County, Grass Valley, p. 311A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 220A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 517A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546372, p. 68.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administrators Bonds, 1863-1878, p. 389.
